reviews.title: Lovely stay at the Windfall House
reviews.text: We stayed at the Windfall house for three nights and it was definately worth it! It was a very lovely home and the innkeeper was terrific! He made a scrumptious breakfast every morning and was very helpful in letting us know what to do around the cape and where to eat. We were a little worried at first that Sandwich would be too far from where we'd want to travel to on the cape, but found that we just loved it. Sandwich is a very charming town and it didn't take long to get around to anywhere.

The Burbank Windfall House in Sandwich, MA is quite a gem of a B&B. The house is a typical colonial New England house. It has been lovingly restored and maintained with beautiful antiques. Our room had a private bath with tub/shower. Ted, the innkeeper, shows his love for this place in all the little details of the house. There is even a small little garden in front with a gazebo and a koi pond. The best feature is the full American breakfast included in the room rate. Breakfast is served in the dining room which even has the original beehive antique oven. Ted used to manage a restaurant before and he is quite the gourmet chef. He gets up every morning at 5 a.m. to prepare breakfast. He prepares the most wonderful fruit breads which are served warm. The two mornings that we were there we had cranberry and banana nut bread. You also get a choice of eggs prepared any way you'd like with home fries and fruit. Or, you can request an omelette with a choice of ingredients. Other guests there raved about the fresh fruit pancakes. Everything is made fresh and delicious! Ted is a friendly and gracious host who offered many suggestions for things to do and offered help with dinner reservations and even a whalewatching reservation in Provincetown. Lastly, Sandwich is a very pretty and quaint historic town worth visiting.
reviews.title: Loved the Burbank Windfall House

reviews.text: way. Ted has a full breakfast menu from which he creates his culinary magic from! Each guest can choose each day what they wish from his extensive selections of eggs cooked different ways served with a selection of breakfast meats, a vast variety of omlettes and ingredients to choose from, and lastly buttermilk or whole wheat pancakes made with an aray of fruits to choose from. I booked based on TripAdvisor reviews but can't agree with the raves. Admittedly we had a weird experience at Burbank's Windfall House. I was sick and we decided to leave early (after one night of a planned two night stay). We notified the innkeeper, Ted, but found him difficult to interact with. Others on here have called him a born innkeeper--I found him not particularly attuned to the nuances of any situation. The room (Samuel Burbank Bedchamber) was nice, if a bit overdecorated, the location good for our purposes, and the price was very reasonable. But the shower! Barely any water, never mind water pressure, and the soap dispenser in the shower dispensed mainly water. You couldn't raise a lather if you tried.

reviews.title: Christmas 2007
reviews.text: Not planned, was the blustery Northeaster that decended on Sandwich during the night leaving 1 ft. of snow. Just listening to the wind while being snug inside, was an adventure. In the morning, Ted made a wonderful breakfast and and took pictures of us in front of the inn which was plastered with snow as if some giant snowblower had pasted by. Definitely, a good place. We would recommend this inn to any one, particularly those, visiting New England for the first time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had never been to Cape Cod before and my wife hadn't been there since childhood so I planned a long weekend to check it out. After a short internet search, I came across Innkeeper Ted Diggle's website (www.windfallhouse.com) for the Aaron Burbank's Windfall House and placed my deposit. My wife thought we were staying at a regular hotel so she was very pleasantly suprised when we pulled into the driveway of this 1800's circa B & B. The place was everything we imagined a quaint, exquisitely decorated bed and breakfast would be, antique fixtures, crooked floors, fireplace going... Ted, the owner is a natural, born-to-be Innkeeper who provided us with a delicious home cooked breakfast each morning as well as excellent suggestions for dinner and local attractions. All this for only $100 per night in the quiet season! Our only regret is that we won't be able to see Ted's "Old Girl", as he fondly refers to the Inn, decorated for Christmas this year. We will be back next December for the Christmas tour though!
reviews.title: Breakfasts to die for!

description: Lovingly restored to its original grandeur, this 1816 colonial house (built by Enos Breed) is located in the heart of Historic Sandwich Village. This gracious antique has retained many of its original features: wideboard pine floors, three fireplaces (one with a beehive oven) and the turned staircase to name a few. Air conditioned, comfortable, affordable bedchambers updated with a Cape Cod feel. Attractive plantings and a side yard provide a perfect setting for relaxing. Resident ghost Antoinetta. Beautifully landscaped grounds, koi pond & gazebo. Plenty of on premise parking. WIFI.
